title: [Large-scale] Online Language Learning Course Development Using Integrated Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design and online learning platform experience, understanding of basic language education principles (integrated four-skills approach, etc.)
context.additional_context: Enhancing the competency of pre-service/in-service teachers to systematically design and develop language education content centered on mobile environments. Particularly, acquiring instructional design techniques and assessment methods for implementing effective language learning activities in digital environments.

learning_goals: Apply the four models of the Integrated Instructional Design (CEM) methodology—instructional, conceptual, interface, and web modeling—to design an online language course, systematically organizing content that integrates listening, speaking, reading, and writing activities.
Develop an online course optimized for smartphone environments, including a user interface and navigation system, and design interactive elements supporting mobile-based language learning activities.
Use formative assessment tools to iteratively improve PBL content and incorporate peer feedback, developing evaluation rubrics and feedback mechanisms for language proficiency enhancement.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
